title: Weird Tales Presents: Women of Weird Fiction Volume 1
description: While Weird Tales Magazine is often mentioned along with some of its most well-known male authors such as H. P. Lovecraft, Robert E. Howard and Clark Ashton Smith, many women have provided ghastly and grotesque contributions throughout the years.  It even had a female editor for fourteen years from 1940 to 1952.  As such, we feel it is about time to shed more light on many of these unheralded female writers who proved that Weird Tales was more than just a boy's club.  In this first of what is hopefully several volumes of such stories, we invite you to dim the lights, light a candle and prepare to experience the weird and wonderful! - Summary by Ben Tucker

sections.title: The Tomb Dweller by Alice I. Fuller
The Magic Mirror by Mary S. Brown
A Certain Soldier by Clare Winger Harris
Tangled Skeins by Mary McEnnery Erhard
Out of the Earth by Christine Campbell Thomson
The City of Lost Souls by Genevieve Larsson
After the Storm by Sarah Harbine Weaver
The Dead Wagon by Greye La Spina
The Amazing Adventure of Joe Scranton Chapters One - Two by Effie W. Fifield
The Amazing Adventure of Joe Scranton Chapters Three - Five by Effie W. Fifield
The Amazing Adventure of Joe Scranton Chapters Six - Eight by Effie W. Fifield
